ygData.subject: Another Lament question
ygData.msgSnippet: I posted yesterday about a problem I had with Lament in Cazic.  Most people agreed that the reason Lamented mobs still aggroed was due to a pathing bug. That
ygData.messageBody:
I posted yesterday about a problem I had with Lament in Cazic. Most people
agreed that the reason Lamented mobs still aggroed was due to a pathing bug.
That is what I assumed was causing the problem but I just wanted to make
sure. Thanks everyone for the info.

Another Lament question.

I have noticed that either one of two things will happen when a mob resists
the Lament song. Sometimes when you get the resist message the mob doesn't
aggro and remains where he is at. You can then reattempt to Lament them.
Other times, the mob will aggro as soon as you get the resist message. It
appears that a second resist check is made if the mobs resists the initial
Lament attempt. If the mob fails the second resist check, he doesn't aggro.
If he makes the second resist check, he aggros on you.

Has anyone else noticed this as well?

Galtin of E'ci
